question.text: Within each pair of elements <math><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></math> , <math><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi></math> , and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtext>Li</mtext><mtext> </mtext></math>and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>Na</mi></math> , respectively, the elements that release more energy upon an electron gain are

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math>
<math><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></math>

solution.text:
(i) Electron affinity of second period p-block element is less than third period p-block element due to small size of second period p-block element, due to small size electron density is more and upcoming electron face extra repulsion, so energy release is less. Hence, EA order: F<Cl.

(ii) Down the group electron affinity decreases due to size increases. EA order: S>Se Li>Na.
